comment.author: 30126889@N08
comment._content:
Did part of this ship interior end up in a Northumberland pub when it was broken up??

I'm probably way off mind!

comment.author: 29295370@N07
comment._content: It's possible... Parts of the engine room controls in this photo www.flickr.com/photos/twm_news/5621049717/in/photostream/ became part of the collection at Tyne & Wear Archives & Museums when Mauretania was dismantled,so it may be that the pub did have sections of it.

comment.author: 30126889@N08
comment._content: I'm sure it was a hotel or pub in the Alnwick area - too far for me to do a pub crawl.   ;)

comment.author: 44841559@N03
comment._content:
You are nearly right.....the White Swan Hotel in Alnwick has a whole dining room from the Olympic (sister ship of the Titanic) which was rescued when she was broken up at Blyth.
A few years ago a whole barn full of artefacts was discovered at Buston (nr Alnwick) and there is more in a pub in Derbyshire....so there are bits of the Olympic everywhere!

comment.author: 30126889@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/44841559@N03]     The power of the internet!!
I knew there were local connections like that. I was a bit off mind....

comment.author: 61212363@N06
comment._content: You're right about the White Swan but the Olympic was broken up at Jarrow. She was bought by Sir John Jarvis, a Surrey MP to provide work for the unemployed after he was moved by the Jarrow marchers

comment.author: 60924671@N02
comment._content: You dont see quality like this anymore :(
